title: State Collections and Housing Court Amendments
description: State Collections and Housing Court Amendments

committee.name: Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice

referrals.name: Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Senate/ received bill from Legislative Research in Waiting for Introduction in the Senate
Senate/ 1st reading (Introduced) in Senate Rules Committee
Senate/ to standing committee in Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee

general_provisions: This bill creates the Collections and Housing Court.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Collections and Housing Court (court);<hr><ltbullet>addresses the postjudgment interest rate of the court;<hr><ltbullet>addresses retention elections for judges of the court, including the ballot language for a retention election;<hr><ltbullet>adds a judge of the court to the definition of "public official" with respect to gifts;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the salary of the judge of the court;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the court as a court of record;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the court is not geographically divided into districts;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the court consists of one judge;<hr><ltbullet>amends the membership of the Judicial Council to include a member of the court;<hr><ltbullet>allows the presiding officer of the Judicial Council to assign a judge of the court to serve in the district court if the assignment does not interfere with actions before the Collections and Housing Court;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the administration of the courts to address the creation of the court;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a judicial hiring freeze for judges of the court;<hr><ltbullet>amends the jurisdiction of the district court to allow a district court judge to preside over an action of the court for purposes of disqualification and recusal; <hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to the court; <hr><ltbullet>provides that the court is a trial court with statewide jurisdiction;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the organization and status of the court; <hr><ltbullet>addresses the jurisdiction of the court; <hr><ltbullet>addresses the administration of the court, including: <hr><ltbullet1>the terms for judges of the court; <hr><ltbullet1>the presiding judge and associate presiding judge of the court; and <hr><ltbullet1>staff and management of the court; <hr><ltbullet>addresses the location and facilities of the court;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the selection process for judges of the court, including the creation of the Collections and Housing Court Nominating Commission;<hr><ltbullet>makes changes to provisions regarding judgments, mileage, and lis pendens to address the creation of the court; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
